# Literature
Distribution
most of N. America from Canada to Mexico, absent from most of the southwest
General Habitat
diverse habitats; include grasslands, shrublands and forests, usually near wetlands
Home or Activity Range
no information available
Specific Habitat Preferences
riparian areas, rocky areas
Nestsite Characteristics
no information available
Foraging Habitat Characteristics
forage in riparian areas, wet meadows
Diet
earthworms, amphibian larvae and adults, small fish, slugs, leeches, snails, birds, small mammals; sometimes insects, spiders, small snakes
Predators
no information available
Shelter Habitats
under logs and rocks; overwinter in rocky areas
Response to Disturbance
no information available
General Sources of Background Information
Storm and Leonard 1995

no information available
